content: Terrorist attacks on mass transportation. Terrorist attacks against mass transportation vehicles and facilities are prohibited under Chapter 97 of title 18, United States Code. Prohibited actions include wrecking, derailing, setting fire to, or disabling vehicles, as well as placing destructive substances without permission. Prohibited actions under Chapter 97 of title 18, United States Code include wrecking mass transportation vehicles, damaging signal systems, interfering with drivers, and committing acts intended to cause death or serious harm. The prohibited actions under Chapter 97 of title 18, United States Code include committing acts intended to cause death or serious harm to employees or passengers of a mass transportation provider, conveying false information about criminal acts, and attempting, threatening, or conspiring to commit any of the prohibited acts. The prohibited actions under Chapter 97 of title 18, United States Code include committing acts intended to cause harm to employees or passengers of a mass transportation provider. Violators may face fines, imprisonment up to 20 years, or both. Additionally, those who possess firearms or dangerous weapons on a mass transportation vehicle or vessel may also be subject to penalties. Whoever possesses a firearm or dangerous weapon on a mass transportation vehicle or vessel with intent to use it in a crime may face fines or imprisonment up to 5 years. This applies if the act is committed on a mass transportation provider engaged in interstate or foreign commerce. A person who kills or attempts to kill in the course of a violation involving mass transportation or a firearm shall be punished accordingly, excluding the death penalty.
